T1059.001.name: Disable or Remove Feature or Program
T1059.001.description: Consider disabling or restricting PowerShell where not required. Use PowerShell Constrained Language Mode to restrict capabilities.

T1059.001.name: Antivirus/Antimalware
T1059.001.description: Anti-virus can be used to automatically quarantine suspicious files with PowerShell scripts.

T1059.001.name: Code Signing
T1059.001.description: Set PowerShell execution policy to require signed scripts. Use AppLocker or Software Restriction Policies.

T1059.001.name: Privileged Account Management
T1059.001.description: Remove PowerShell from systems where not required. Restrict PowerShell execution to privileged accounts only.

T1059.003.name: Execution Prevention
T1059.003.description: Use application control to prevent execution of cmd.exe if not required. Block command-line interpreters through AppLocker.

T1059.003.name: Privileged Account Management
T1059.003.description: Restrict cmd.exe execution to privileged accounts. Remove unnecessary access for standard users.

T1566.001.name: Antivirus/Antimalware
T1566.001.description: Anti-virus can automatically quarantine malicious email attachments before delivery to users.

T1566.001.name: Network Intrusion Prevention
T1566.001.description: Network intrusion prevention systems and email gateways can be used to detect and block malicious attachments.

T1566.001.name: Restrict Web-Based Content
T1566.001.description: Block email attachments that can execute macros (e.g., .doc, .xls, .xlsm). Only allow safe file types.

T1566.001.name: User Training
T1566.001.description: Train users to identify phishing emails and avoid opening suspicious attachments. Conduct regular phishing simulations.

T1566.002.name: Network Intrusion Prevention
T1566.002.description: Network intrusion prevention systems can be used to block URLs associated with known malicious domains.

T1566.002.name: Restrict Web-Based Content
T1566.002.description: Block access to known malicious web domains through DNS filtering and web proxies.

T1566.002.name: User Training
T1566.002.description: Train users to identify phishing links. Teach verification techniques (hover before clicking, check sender).

T1071.001.name: Network Intrusion Prevention
T1071.001.description: Network intrusion detection and prevention systems can identify C2 traffic patterns. Use SSL/TLS inspection.

T1071.001.name: Filter Network Traffic
T1071.001.description: Filter outbound web traffic through web proxies. Block access to known malicious domains and IP addresses.

T1486.name: Data Backup
T1486.description: Maintain offline, encrypted backups of critical data. Test backup restoration regularly.

T1486.name: Behavior Prevention on Endpoint
T1486.description: Use endpoint protection that can detect and block ransomware behavior (rapid file encryption).

T1486.name: Restrict File and Directory Permissions
T1486.description: Restrict write access to critical directories. Use least privilege principles for file access.

T1055.name: Behavior Prevention on Endpoint
T1055.description: Use endpoint protection that can detect process injection techniques (memory writes, thread manipulation).

T1055.name: Privileged Account Management
T1055.description: Restrict debug privileges to administrators only. Minimize accounts with SeDebugPrivilege.

T1027.name: Antivirus/Antimalware
T1027.description: Anti-malware can detect obfuscated code patterns and malicious packers.

T1027.name: Behavior Prevention on Endpoint
T1027.description: Use endpoint protection that analyzes behavior rather than just signatures to detect obfuscated malware.

T1082.name: Operating System Configuration
T1082.description: Restrict access to system information commands through application control policies.

T1083.name: Restrict File and Directory Permissions
T1083.description: Use file system permissions to restrict access to sensitive directories.

T1087.name: Operating System Configuration
T1087.description: Restrict access to account enumeration utilities through application control.

T1005.name: Restrict File and Directory Permissions
T1005.description: Use file permissions to restrict access to sensitive data files.

T1005.name: Data Loss Prevention
T1005.description: Implement DLP solutions to detect and block unauthorized data collection.

T1041.name: Network Intrusion Prevention
T1041.description: Network monitoring can detect abnormal data flows and large outbound transfers.

T1041.name: Data Loss Prevention
T1041.description: DLP solutions can detect and block data exfiltration attempts.

T1190.name: Exploit Protection
T1190.description: Use exploit protection features like DEP, ASLR, and CFG. Deploy WAF for web applications.

T1190.name: Vulnerability Scanning
T1190.description: Regularly scan public-facing applications for vulnerabilities and misconfigurations.

T1190.name: Privileged Account Management
T1190.description: Run public-facing applications with minimal privileges. Use separate service accounts.

T1078.name: Password Policies
T1078.description: Enforce strong password policies and multi-factor authentication for all accounts.

T1078.name: Privileged Account Management
T1078.description: Implement privileged access management (PAM). Use just-in-time access provisioning.

T1078.name: User Account Management
T1078.description: Regularly audit accounts and remove unused or dormant accounts.
